query.queryString: (/article/relations/categories/collection/code='resultsPack,projectsInfoPack,brief' OR (/result/relations/categories/collection/code='deliverable,publication' OR contenttype='project')) AND ('SUSTAINABILITY' OR 'INNOVATION' OR 'MULTI-CRITERIA')

warnings.message: One of the fields on which a sort was requested does not exist

result.title: Tools for science-society-policy interfaces
result.description: The aim is to provide visual tools supported in the VRE which can inform the wider public as well as stakeholders engaged in MOVING, and also support decision-making: friendly spatial plan to view and explore stakeholders’ information, and easy-to read story maps and ‘Science Digest’ on issues related to mapping mountain areas vulnerability. These tools will be used to facilitate and enrich participatory discussions along the project, and to raise awareness of main stakeholders participating in the CoP and MaPs.

result.title: DECO strategy_ final
result.description: A draft of the strategy will be presented at the kick-off meeting to the Consortium members to get feedback and encourage ownership and participation in the design. The initial version of the DECO strategy will be released in month 6 (including a more detailed planning of the activities during M6-18), but the strategy will be a living document to be reviewed and adapted during the whole project duration. AEIDL, in collaboration with the communications taskforce will be responsible for updating the DECO strategy, plan and monitor the main DECO activities to be conducted during every year.

category.title: innovation management
category.displayCode: /social sciences/economics and business/business and management/innovation management

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

category.description: Programme: Legal basis for research funding

result.description: Description and analysis of the sensitivity (relative to baseline outputs from D3.4) of each of the food web models to a standardised set of mesopelagic harvesting scenarios at each of the locations to which they are applied, and comparison of model results for locations where several models are in place.

result.title: A parameterization of use in future IPCC-class model analysis
result.description: A parameterization of use in future IPCC-class model analysis (M48) Analysis of the complementary models used across WP4 will be used to derive empirical relationships between the size of the 3 fluxes (active, gravitational and DOC) and fields commonly reproduced by global biogeochemical models (e.g. primary production, grazing, export, temperature, oxygen). These relationships can then be used to parameterise the role of the mesopelagic in retaining carbon in the ocean in such models.

result.title: Airport circularity base line study
result.description: In this study the level of circularity of SNBV will be assessed This will be done by firstly creating a shared definition of circularity Secondly waste and resource streams are mapped This mapping exercise will be enriched by providing information available on volume weight environmental impact etc The results of this baseline study will form a basis for the performance measurement system the demopilot in the terminal as well as the impact assessment of the circularity practicesLinked to task 61

result.title: H2-GPU prototype for demonstrations
result.description: Activities performed to develop a hydrogen fuel cell powered GPU based on a battery or diesel GPU base. Included will be key design and exploitation aspects such as: operational profile for the H-GPU, service for a typical day and develop hybrid power design, form factor/space limitations, integration strategy, hybrid hydrogen + battery power solution design choices, general arrangement of components in the available spaces, hydrogen system sizing, Integration design, and factory and commissioning testing activities performed. (Linked to tasks 4.2 and 4.3)(Linked to tasks 4.2 and 4.3)

result.title: Replicable framework with boundary conditions for successful PtL projects
result.description: Key conditions in different areas eg climate policy availability of cheap CO2 sources for the success of PtL based SAF production plants will be determined and detailed in this report Based on this favorable areas for the further upscaling of this pathway in both the EU and beyond will be identifiedLinked to task 53

result.title: Carbon footprint method for combined passenger-freight operations
result.description: The Deliverable will describe methodology developed in task 8.6 for emission computation and emission allocation between passengers and freight for the passenger-freight combined services (air transport and airports). The described methodology will show where and when deviations from the established methods, such as IATA RP 1678 are necessary, and how to deal with the situations when real world primary data is missing. This methodology will be used for determining of emissions and footprint of door-to-door intermodal aviation networks.(Linked to task 8.6)

result.title: Toolbox to assess feasibility and benefits of an on-airport PtL facility site
result.description: This toolbox will enable airports to determine whether on-airport production of SAF using DAC PtL is feasible. Topics that will be included are: high-level permit overview, potential impact on day to day operations at the airport, requirements on the downstream supply of the SAF before entering the airport fuel infrastructure, plant size and utility requirements.(Linked to task 5.3)
